item.title: Janine add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Janine add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Love is so short, forgetting is so long." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Janine add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I want To do with you what spring does with the cherry trees." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Janine add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Listen. To live is to be marked. To live is to change, to acquire the words of a story, and that is the only celebration we mortals really know. In perfect stillness, frankly, I've only found sorrow." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Janine add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Touch comes before sight, before speech. It is the first language and the last, and it always tells the truth." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Janine add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description:
"When you're young, you think everything you do is disposable. You move from now to now, crumpling time up in your hands, tossing it away. You're your own speeding car. You think you can get rid of things, and people tooâ€”leave them behind. You don't yet know about the habit they have, of coming back.
Time in dreams is frozen. You can never get away from where you've been." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Janine add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "life's not a paragraph And death i think is no parenthesis" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Janine add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "The snow doesn't give a soft white damn whom it touches." -- E.E. Cummings
